messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dr. Laura and predjudice
messages.msgSnippet: When one is a public figure and uses that platform to pronounce as facts opinions, particularly racist and bigotted remarks, then they place themselves open to
messages.messageBody:
When one is a public figure and uses that platform to pronounce as facts
opinions, particularly racist and bigotted remarks, then they place
themselves open to criticism.

I already quoted what she said about gays, that is what the quote marks
around certain discriptive phrases were all about. Those were direct
quotes, not my opinion about what she was saying.

I really don't see how you could call that out of character for Laura, PhD.
She is consistantly rude, judgemental and quite frequently sounds like a
screeching fishmongers wife.

Further, I know several traditional Jews and none of them go around
pontificating or making judgemental pronouncements.

Now, correct me if I am wrong (like I believe anyone wouldn't <g>), BUT, if
would seem to me that if on the one hand one believes that being homosexual
is a sin, one could not on the other hand support adoption by homosexual
couples.

And, I don't see what difference it would make whether or not one heard the
whole tape, there is no justification for calling your children names and
certainly none for those type names, whole tape or no whole tape.

Lynda, who was heartily sick of Laura S before she became a thread on this
list and is more so now %-}
----------
> From: Dia Garland <moocow@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dr. Laura and predjudice
> Date: Wednesday, June 28, 2000 10:02 AM
>
>
>
> > Well, to be exact, I've never called my kids worthless little mf'ers.
> That
> > is just one incident, there are many, many more that have been
documented
> > but I didn't think I needed to write a book, I just included one of her
> > nastier moments that happened to get caught on tape. And, if I had my
> > children at work, I certainly wouldn't berate them in front of all my
> > employees, either<<
>
> Since I have never heard the tape, and probably never will, I won't say
that
> she never said that. You do need to be careful about listening to patial
> tape recordings, especially when produced by people who don't like the
one
> "caught" on tape. I will say that the comment sounds highly out of
> character for Dr. Laura.
>
> I am not trying to jump to her defense here, I don't like all that she
says
> or believes in either, but it sounds t me like some of you are tarring
and
> feathering her because you don't like her views. What happened to "don't
be
> judgemental"?
>
> Dr. Laura is an observant Jew, so it stands to reason that she would call
> homosexuality a sin. She believes in the Old Testament, and
homosexuality
> is called a sin there. I have never heard her condemn homosexuals, just
the
> behavior. I have heard her support adoption rights for homosexual
couples,
> so I have difficulty believing that she hates all homosexuals.
>
> Some of you have condemned her for "not living what she preaches" because
> she is not at home with her son, and instead works. Her son goes to
school,
> and she works during the hours he is in school only. Her husband is a
full
> time parent for their son. Why on earth would you condemn her for this?
>
> > She's also a religous bigot. Oh, and did I mention an expert on all
> > religions that she has never heard of.<<
>
> I have never heard her be a religious bigot. She is open about her own
> religious choice, and the journey that brought her there, but I haven't
> heard her demean any other religion. Have you?
>
>
